title: Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415)
summary: This page provides information about the now-closed Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415) for both visa holders and sponsors. It outlines rights, obligations, work conditions, reporting requirements, and sponsorship responsibilities. It also directs users to the Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) as an alternative for new applications.

visa_information.purpose: For people who have already been granted a Foreign Government Agency visa to understand their rights and obligations.

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
Meet Australian taxation obligations if working in Australia

prohibited_actions: Stopping work for the sponsoring employer
Working in a position or occupation not nominated in the visa application
Working for another person or for yourself while employed by the sponsoring employer
if_employment_ends: Find another employer willing to sponsor you
Leave Australia within 28 days or before visa expiry, whichever is earlier

family_member_conditions: Family members included on the visa must enter Australia with or after the primary visa holder
They must leave Australia with or before the primary visa holder
They must continue to be a member of the family unit

must_notify_changes: Changes to phone number, email, address or passport

tools.vevo: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) can be used to check visa details and entitlements

general_information.note: You cannot apply to sponsor someone for this visa
general_information.vevo_for_organisations: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations) allows checking visa details of sponsored persons

sponsors.relation_to_subclass_403: New applications for the Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) do not require sponsorship

list_of_obligations: Tell Home Affairs when certain events occur
Provide records and information to the Minister
Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Ensure the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity
sponsor_obligations.responsibility_note: Sponsors are responsible for meeting all obligations, even when using an authorised representative

investigation_scope: Whether sponsorship obligations are being or have been complied with
Whether an illegal worker has been hired
Other circumstances where administrative action could be taken

obligation_period.starts: day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.ends: five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases

examples_of_cooperation: Producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe
Not preventing access to persons with custody of required records
Providing officers access to interview persons on premises

requirements: Some records must be independently verifiable
records_to_keep: Any required notification to Home Affairs
Date, method and location of notifications

obligation_period.ends: two years after the sponsor is no longer approved AND no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: Provide records or information requested by departmental officers
Records requested may relate to sponsorship obligations or other matters relevant to administrative action
must_provide_if: Required under Commonwealth, state or territory law
Required to be kept as a sponsor

obligation_period.starts: day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.ends: two years after sponsorship/work agreement ceases AND no sponsored visa holder remains

must_notify_events: Cessation or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment
Any changes to sponsor's address or contact details in the original sponsorship application
additional_notes: If expected cessation does not occur or date changes, the sponsor must notify Home Affairs

obligation_period.starts: day the sponsorship or work agreement is approved
obligation_period.ends: two years after sponsorship/work agreement ends AND no one is being sponsored

ensure_participation_in_nominated_activi.requirement: Sponsor must ensure visa holder only participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity
ensure_participation_in_nominated_activi.changes: A new nomination application is required if the visa holder is to be engaged in a different occupation, program or activity
